data.title: Obituary for Gregory Russell Davis
data.meta_description: Obituary for Gregory Davis | Evansville, IN |  Gregory Davis, 46, of Newburgh, died at 2:07...
data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Gregory Russell Davis | Boone Funeral Home
data.text:
Gregory Davis, 46, of Newburgh, died at 2:07 a.m. today at his home from cancer after a long illness.

Mr. Davis was a professor of music at the University of Ev­ansville, a teacher and concert pianist. He performed widely in the United States, Europe and South America. He also ap­peared in many hundreds of concerts on the University of Evansville campus and in the Evansville community for the past 20 years.

He was a member of the Philharmonic Orchestra and had served at various times as pianist or musical director for the Evansville Master Chorale,

the Encore Dinner Theatre, Methodist Temple, Newburgh Presbyterian Church, the Ev­ansville Chamber Players, the New England Music Camp and the University of Evansville Theatre.

Mr. Davis spent a year at the University of Aberdeen, Scot­land, on the Fulbright-Hays Teacher Exchange program.

Surviving are his wife of 16 years, the former Donna Mayse; daughters, Elizabeth and Jenni­fer; his mother, Frances Davis of Lisle, Illinois.; sisters, Denise Da­vis of St. Louis, and Missette Kobler of Naperville, Illinois.; a brother, Kenton Davis of Balti­more; and two nieces.

A private graveside service will be at 10 a.m. Friday at Rose Hill Cemetery in Newburgh, the Rev. Ernest Stair officiating.

Friends may call from 2 to 8 p.m. tomorrow at Boone Funer­al Home — East Chapel, 5330 Washington Ave. Evansville, IN, 47715

The family said friends, if they wish, may make memorial contributions to the University of Evansville Music Depart­ment or Theatre Department, the Evansville Philharmonic, the Evansville Chess Club or the New England Music Camp.
